sen.j: 園部城（そのべじょう）は京都府南丹市にあった城郭(当初は陣屋）である。
sen.e: Sonobe-jo Castle is located (initially as Jinya (a government house) in Nantan City, Kyoto Prfecture.
Sonobe-jo Castle is located (initially as Jinya - a government house) in Nantan City, Kyoto Prfecture.
Sonobe-jo Castle is located (initially as Jinya - a government house) in Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Summary

sen.j: 但馬国出石より移封された外様大名の小出吉親により、元和5年（1619年）より2年の歳月をかけ築かれた。
sen.e: Yoshichika KOIDE, a tozama daimyo (territorial samurai lord who swore loyalty to the Tokugawa clan after the Battle of Sekigahara when Tokugawa became shogun) whose territory was transferred there from Izushi, Tajima Province, buit the carle in two years from 1619.

Yoshichika KOIDE, a tozama daimyo (territorial samurai lord who swore loyalty to the Tokugawa clan after the Battle of Sekigahara when Tokugawa became shogun) whose territory was transferred there from Izushi, Tajima Province, buit the castle in two years starting from 1619.

Yoshichika KOIDE, a tozama daimyo (territorial samurai lord who swore loyalty to the Tokugawa clan after the Battle of Sekigahara when Tokugawa became shogun) whose territory was transferred there from Izushi, Tajima Province, built the castle in two years starting from 1619.

sen.j: 川を天然の堀として利用し、加えて堀を巡らせ守りを固めた。
sen.e: He sorrounded the castle with moats, with natural river flow used in some part of them.
He sorrounded the castle with a moats, with a natural river flow used in some parts of them.
He surrounded the castle with a moats, with a natural river flow used in some parts of them.

sen.j: 現在は京都府立園部高等学校の敷地となり、現存する建物は敷地内にある。
sen.e: Now, the Kyoto Prefectural Sonobe high school (京都府立園部高等学校) is placed there, with the relics located in the premises.
Now, the Kyoto Prefectural Sonobe high school (京都府立園部高等学校) is placed there, with the relics located on the premises.
Now, the Kyoto Prefectural Sonobe High School is placed there, with the relics located on the premises.
sen.cmt: High School大文字にしました。

sen.j: 藩主の小出氏は外様大名ながら、藩主2人を幕閣に輩出している。
sen.e: Although the Koide clan was a tozama daimyo lord, its two lords gained a bakkaku position (minister-level position in the bukufu government).
Although the Koide clan was a tozama daimyo lord, its two lords gained a bakkaku position (minister-level position in the bukufu government).
Although the Koide clan was a tozama daimyo lord, its two lords gained a bakkaku position (minister-level position in the bukufu government).

sen.j: 10代藩主英尚の時に幕末を迎えている。
sen.e: The bukufu system ended when Fusanao KOIDE was the ten-th lord.
The bukufu system ended when Fusanao KOIDE was the tenth lord.
The bukufu system ended when Fusanao KOIDE was the 10th lord.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争の時に京都御所の安全が脅かせられる怖れがでてきたため、御所から近くの園部陣屋に明治天皇を迎える計画があったと言われる。
sen.e: It is said that, in the Boshin war, there was a plan to move Meiji Emperor to the Sonobe jinya located near to the palace, because the safety of the Kyoto palace became threatened.
It is said that, in the Boshin war, there was a plan to move the Meiji Emperor to the Sonobe jinya located near the palace, because the safety of the Kyoto palace was threatened.
It is said that, in the Boshin War, there was a plan to move the Emperor Meiji to the Sonobe jinya located near the palace, because the safety of the Kyoto palace was threatened.
sen.cmt: War大文字にしました。Emperor Meijiとしました。

sen.j: そのためか明治新政府から陣屋をより堅牢な城郭とする許可を受け、明治元年（1868年）から2年の歳月をかけ、櫓門・巽櫓、小麦山の三層櫓などが築かれた。
sen.e: Perhaps for this reason, the lord got a permission from the new Meiji government to convert the jinya into a more solidly-built castle, and built a yagura-mon gate, a tatsumi-yagura turret, and a three-layer turret on Komugi-yama Mountain in two years from 1868.

Perhaps for this reason, the lord got permission from the new Meiji government to convert the jinya into a more solidly-built castle, and built a yagura-mon gate, a tatsumi-yagura turret, and a three-layer turret on Komugi-yama Mountain in two years starting from 1868.

Perhaps for this reason, the lord got permission from the new Meiji government to convert the jinya into a more solidly-built castle, and built a yagura-mon gate, a tatsumi-yagura turret, and a three-layer turret on Komugi-yama Mountain in two years starting from 1868.

sen.j: しかし、明治5年（1872年）、現在まで残る建物以外は取り壊された。
sen.e: However, in 1872, the buildings other than those that still remain were destroyed and removed.
However, in 1872, the buildings other than those that still remain were destroyed and removed.
However, in 1872, the buildings other than those that still remain were destroyed and removed.

sen.j: 太鼓櫓 八木町の安楽寺に移築
sen.e: The taiko yagura (drum turret): was moved to Anraku-ji Temple in Yagi-cho
The taiko yagura (drum turret): was moved to Anraku-ji Temple in Yagi-cho
